column4: I will paypal $50 to anyone that can make my touchpad stop respodning to taps as clicks.
I've been asking about this for 2 weeks and no one can help me. I'm at my wits end.
this is an option in gnome-mouse-properties but it doesn't fraking work
at all
Edit that feature using gconf-editor. I will get you the key, one sec
in a terminal type `gconf-editor` then when it opens, browse to desktop/gnome/peripherals/touchpad/ then untick the tap_to_click box
don't bother, its already disabled in gconf-editor. The key is /desktop/gnome/peripherals/touchpad/tap_to_click
And that key does not do it?
nope. it ignores it. If I check it and then uncheck it, it works for about 10 minutes
Have you tried syndaemon? maybe that will do it.
I've yet to have luck with it either to be honest
Hm, mine works quite well. Let me give you the syndaemon I am running, just to try it :)
syndaemon -i 1 -d -K
would that have to be applied at every boot or how does syndaemon work?
Yes, it does. I added it to the startup programs.
It sticks through every boot.
okay I'll give it a shot
Just add it to the `Startup Applications` did you want the command again?
no I got it
Rip the cd as an .iso
its a cdr file
Sorry, I thought you meant, a CD-R... Oops.
